snippet: Stocks on Wall Street closed sharply lower and benchmark bond prices marched higher as the latest jobs data in the United States provided evidence that the economy was still struggling.
abstract: Stocks drop more than 2 percent, their worst daily performance in 2012, as United States government bond yields fall to record lows; downturn reflects fears about the intensifying European debt crisis, a cooling economy in China, and weak employment in the United States and the euro zone.
lead_paragraph: Stocks on Wall Street closed sharply lower and benchmark bond prices marched higher as the latest jobs data in the United States provided evidence that the economy was still struggling.

headline.main: Wall Street Tumbles 2% on Jobs Data
headline.print_headline: Wall Street Tumbles 2% on Jobs Data
